default: (a) a {@item longsword|phb} or (b) any {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) an {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (b) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}
(a) an {@item arcane focus|phb} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}

subclasses.name: Summoner
subclassFeatures: Shared Mind of the Drakes|Dragon Warrior|DW|Summoner|DW|10

entries: Born or inheriting draconic power, a dragon warrior is one who utilizes the ancient might of dragons and incorperates it into their everyday life. From defending themselves in combat, to using the various draconic magicks to make their day to day activities easier, to using their connection to their draconic blood to communicate with other dragons, a dragon warrior has plenty of versatility to play with.
fluff.name: Dragon Warrior

classFeature.name: Draconic Origin
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you have draconic blood running through your veins as part of your draconic inheritance. You gain the following benefits:
You learn how to speak, read, and write draconic. If you already have draconic from another source, you can choose one other language.

Choose either chromatic, gem, or metallic, then choose from either black, blue, green, red, or white for chromatic. Brass, bronze, copper, gold, or silver for metallic. These determine your draconic origin, what type of dragon is responsible for your powers, and what type of scales riddle your body.
Depending on your choice, you gain resistance to a specific damage type.
If you choose metallic, you gain proficiency in your choice of either an artisan’s tool or a musical instrument.
If you choose chromatic, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills: deception, intimidation, performance, or persuasion.
If you choose gem, you can speak, read, and write in one other language of your choosing from the common or exotic languages.

classFeature.name: Draconian Body
entries: Your body is riddled with dragon-like scales, granting you natural armor. While you are not wearing armor your AC equals 13 + your constitution modifier. You can still gain the benefits of a shield.

classFeature.name: Draconian Powers
entries: Also at 2nd level you learn the ancient secrets of dragons. You know two draconian powers. You gain additional powers as shown in the Draconian Powers column in the Dragon Warrior Table.

classFeature.name: Draconian Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a feature granted by your Draconian Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at fifth level, when you take the attack action on your turn you can make an additional weapon attack.

classFeature.name: Draconian Archetype Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Draconian Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Draconian Archetype Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Draconian Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Draconian Archetype Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Draconian Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Draconian Archetype Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Draconian Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Draconian Archetype Feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted by your Draconian Archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Summoner
entries: Draconic blood flowing through your veins may not be enough. Sometimes, you need an extra set of hands, or claws rather. In addition to draconic blood, you have a dragon’s soul intertwined with yours. Realizing the hidden power within your soul, you can call upon that soul and magically create a companion that is a manifestation of the draconic soul within you.

subclassFeature.name: Manifest Dragon
entries: Starting at 3rd level, as an action you can manifest a magical dragon to aid you in battle. Use the {@creature Magen Dragon|DW} stat block. In addition to being a construct, the creature is also treated as a dragon. In combat, the Magen Dragon shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, the Magen Dragon can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge}.
The manifested dragon uses your proficiency bonus rather than its own and its armor class is 13 plus your proficiency bonus.
Once the Magen Dragon has been reduced to 0 hit points, it is destroyed and cannot be manifested again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Unleash Draconic Fury
entries: Also at 3rd level, when you take the attack action while your dragon is manifested, you can forgo one of your attacks to have your Magen Dragon make an attack instead. You can only do so once per round.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Manifestation
entries: At 7th level, your manifested dragon has become stronger and is a more viable asset. Its size becomes large and can speak, read, and write common and draconic. If you spend 8 hours training your dragon, it can learn an additional language, but only if you know the language yourself. In addition, the Magen Dragon gains the following improvements:

items: It can attack twice when it takes the attack action.
Its breath weapon’s damage increases by 2d6 and its range increases by 15 ft.
Its Bite is considered magical for the purposes of overcoming non-magical resistances.
It can increase one of its ability scores by 2, or two of them by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Mind of the Drakes
entries: At 10th level, you can now link with your manifested dragon’s senses. You can temporarily transfer your consciousness to your manifested dragon. As an action, you can see through your dragon's eyes and hear through its ears. During this time, you are {@condition deafened} and {@condition blinded}. You can sustain this effect for up to 10 minutes, and you can end it at any time (requires no action).
If you or your dragon takes damage, you must make a concentration check as if you were concentrating on a spell. If you fail, this effect ends and your senses are returned to normal.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Manifestation
entries: At 14th level, your manifested dragon has reached its adulthood and is now a fierce foe in combat. Its size becomes huge. In addition, the Magen Dragon gains the following improvements:

items: Its Bite deals an additional 1d10 damage corresponding to its breath weapon.
Its breath weapon’s damage increases by 2d6 and the range of its cone increases by 30 ft.
It can increase one of its ability scores by 2, or two of them by 1.
Its movement speed increases by 20 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Mournful Sacrifice
entries: At 18th level, if you were to die by any means while your dragon is manifested, you can instantly destroy your manifestation and expend all remaining uses of your Manifest Dragon feature to avoid dying. When you do so, you are brought to your feet at 1 hit point instead.
Sacrificing your dragon in this way leaves a scar on your magical ability to manifest it.

The first time your manifested dragon is destroyed in this manner, you cannot summon it again under any circumstance for 7 days. Each time afterward increases the amount of time by an additional 7 days, up until after the third time you’ve done so. In which case, if it is destroyed in this way again, you cannot summon it again by any means. Only a wish spell can restore your ability to manifest your dragon, upon which you can use this feature once before you lose the ability to manifest it again under the same means.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Manifestation
entries: At 20th level, your dragon has reached its peak potential and is now your most powerful ally. Its size becomes gargantuan and deals twice as much damage to structures and objects. In addition, the Magen Dragon gains the following improvements:

items: It can make three attacks when it takes the attack action instead of twice.
Its breath weapon’s damage increases by 2d6 and the range of its cone increases by 30 ft.
It can increase one of its ability scores by 2, or two of them by 1.
It can act on its own, without requiring you to command it while you aren’t incapacitated.

entries: You can manifest your dragon twice before completing a long rest instead of once, but you can only have one dragon manifested at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Invoker
entries: Invokers have harnessed the powers that dwell within them, their bodies becoming more and more dragon-like as they unlock more powers. As an invoker you focus less on physical capabilities and more so on spellcasting.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you have discovered an ancient heritage of magical prowess and have gained the ability to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and {@book chapter 11|PHB|11} for the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=Sorcerer}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter sorcerer spell list|spells|class=sorcerer}. You learn an additional sorcerer cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Invoker Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your sorcerer spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell shield} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell shield} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level sorcerer spells of your choice.

The Spells Known column of the Invoker Spellcasting table shows when you learn more sorcerer spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an abjuration or evocation spell of your choice, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.
The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th level can come from any school of magic.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the sorcerer spells you know with another spell of your choice from the sorcerer spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your sorcerer spells, since you learn your spells through supernatural powers. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a sorcerer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Invoke Energy
entries: At 3rd level, you have a pool of Invoke Energy equal to twice your proficiency bonus, you regain spent invoke energy after a long rest. You learn two invocations that you can spend invoke energy and a bonus action to use them:

entries.name: Draconic Arms
entries: By spending 1 invoke energy, you morph your arms and hands into dragon-like appendages. You gain a natural weapon in the form of claws. These claws use strength for your attack and damage rolls and deal 2d6 slashing damage on hit. You can make an attack using these claws as part of this bonus action. This invocation lasts for 1 minute, after which your appendages return to normal.

entries.name: Draconic Legs
entries: By spending 1 invoke energy, you morph your legs and feet into dragon-like appendages. Your movement speed increases by 10 ft and you can take the dash action as a bonus action. You can take the dash action as part of this bonus action. This invocation lasts for 1 minute, after which your appendages return to normal.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Invocations
entries: At 7th level you can choose one of the following invocations to learn, you learn another invocation at 15th and 20th levels:

entries.name: Draconic Build
entries: As an action, you can spend 2 invoke energy to morph your torso into a more draconic-like one. The scales you have become more defined and you become more durable. Your armor class increases by 2 and you gain 10 temporary hit points. If you are hit with a melee attack while you have these temporary hit points, the attacker takes 10 points of damage. This damage is correspondent to the damage you resist from your Draconic Origins. This invocation lasts for 1 minute, or until you lose these temporary hit points, after which your torso returns to normal. You can spend an additional 2 invoke energy to increase the temporary hit points and damage by 10, but the duration of the invocation is halved.

entries.name: Draconic Eyes
entries: As a bonus action, you can spend 2 invoke energy to morph your head into a dragon’s head. During which time your darkvision is increased by 60 ft and you gain a blindsight of 10 ft. You can also see into the ethereal plane and see invisible creatures and objects. They appear as if they were ethereal outlines. This invocation lasts for 1 minute, after which your head returns to normal. You can spend an additional 2 invoke energy to double the range of this increase, but the duration of the invocation is halved.

entries.name: Dragonfire
entries: As a bonus action you can spend 2 invoke energy, dragonfire erupts from a weapon you choose. That weapon deals an additional 1d6 damage, this damage corresponds to the damage you resist from your Draconic Origins. This invocation lasts for 1 minute, or until you end it as a bonus action. You can make a single weapon attack as part of this bonus action. You can spend 2 additional invoke energy to boost the dragonfire’s damage by an additional d6, but the duration of the invocation is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Invocation Replenishment
entries: Starting at 10th level, as a bonus action you can spend a spell slot to regain an amount of spent invoke energy equal to the spell slot’s level. You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Adept Invocations
entries: At 14th level, whenever you would spend invoke energy to boost an invocation, you can choose not to spend the extra energy and still gain the boost. You can do so once, and regain the ability to do so after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Invoke Arcane
entries: At 18th level, you add your spellcasting ability modifier to the damage of your spells. In addition, you can spend any number of invoke energy to re-roll the same number of damage dice for a spell that deals damage. You must use the new result, even if it is lower than the original.

subclassFeature.name: Invocation Mastery
entries: At 20th level, when you roll initiative with no invoke energy, you regain 4. In addition, when you finish a short rest you replenish half of your invoke energy.
Also, whenever you use your action or bonus action to spend invoke energy, you can immediately cast a spell with the same casting time as the action you used. You can only do so once per round.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Scribe
entries: With the ancient power of draconic runes, these dragon warriors tattoo themselves with unwieldy magic. They learn these ancient runes as they grow stronger and are passed on to them from the knowledge of their ancestors. Awaken the truths behind your draconic origins and learn the ancient ways.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Tattoos
entries: Starting at 3rd level, magic runes appear on your person. These runes represent an ancient dialect of old draconic. If it is relevant for your campaign, you learn of the oldest form of draconic, predating the one currently being used. These runes hold significant power represented by long forgotten old magicks.

entries.name: Rune of Power
entries: You’ve harnessed the power of the old magicks and can release outward a blast of arcane energy. You learn the Eldritch Blast cantrip and can cast it using Charisma as your spellcasting ability modifier, only instead of force damage, it deals the damage corresponding to the damage you resist from your Draconic Origin. You also add your spellcasting ability modifier to the damage of this cantrip. Instead of green eldritch energy, the beam takes the form of wispy dragon-like flames more akin to a dragon’s breath weapon.

As an action, you can invoke a more latent power of the rune. Any time after you cast the Eldritch Blast cantrip while the boon is invoked, one of the beams deals an additional 1d10 damage. This boon lasts for 1 hour, after which you cannot invoke the power of this rune again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Rune of Knowledge
entries: You’ve gained a rune that grants you knowledge of the ancient world. During a short rest or long rest, you can spend 10 minutes meditating, reminiscing of the past. When you do so, you can learn of old techniques used for modern items. You gain proficiency in one tool or skill of your choosing. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this tool or skill. You lose proficiency in this skill if you use this feature again.

As an action, you can invoke a more latent power of the rune, granting you a boon of untapped knowledge. While the boon is invoked, each time you roll an ability check that doesn’t add your proficiency bonus using Intelligence, you add half of your proficiency bonus to that check. This boon lasts for 1 hour, after which you cannot invoke the power of this rune again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Rune of Draconic Weaponry
entries: Instead of being scribed on your person, you can scribe this rune onto a weapon of your choosing. That weapon becomes enhanced by the rune’s ancient magic, allowing it to take a more draconic-like appearance riddled with scales.

The weapon becomes magical for the purposes of overcoming non-magical resistances if it wasn’t magical already. In addition to the weapon’s normal damage, it also gains a bonus 1d4 damage corresponding to the damage type you resist from your Draconic Origins. You can only apply this bonus once per round. This bonus damage increases to a 1d6 at 5th level, a 1d8 at 11th, and a 1d10 at 17th. You can only have one weapon inscribed with this rune’s magic at a time.

As an action, you can invoke a more latent power of the rune, granting you a boon of untapped strength. While the boon is invoked, every round you have advantage on your first weapon attack made with a weapon etched with this rune. This boon lasts for 1 hour, after which you cannot invoke the power of this rune again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Runic Power
entries: Starting at 7th level, you’ve begun to delve more into your runic arts, learning more and more of the ancient ways. Choose one of the following runes to learn:

entries.name: Rune of Recovery
entries: You’ve etched a tattoo of old magicks capable of mending wounds. As an action you touch a creature, they regain 1d10 + your Charisma modifier hit points and are cured from one disease or poison afflicting them. You have a number of uses of this rune equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses after a short or long rest.

As an action, you can invoke a more latent power of the rune, granting you a boon of health. While the rune is invoked, you have advantage on saving throws made to resist poison and disease and you restore a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus at the start of each of your turns, so long as you have at least 1 hit point. This boon lasts for 1 minute, after which you cannot invoke the power of this rune again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Rune of Blustering Winds
entries: A magic tattoo appears on your back, resembling runes in the shape of dragon-like wings. Whenever you take the dash action, you do not provoke opportunity attacks and you ignore the effects of difficult terrain. As a reaction, whenever a ranged weapon attack would hit you, you can impose disadvantage on that attack, potentially causing it to miss as you summon forth a powerful gale from the palm of your hands.

As an action, you can invoke a more latent power of the rune, granting you a boon of immense speed enough to lift you off your feet. While the rune is invoked, you have a flying speed of 30 ft and you can hover. If you do not have a flying speed, whether it be natural or provided by magic, you cannot ascend any higher than 30 ft or you start falling. If you already have a flying speed, it is increased by 30 ft. This boon lasts for 1 minute, after which you cannot invoke the power of this rune again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Rune of Foresight
entries: A rune appears over your forehead, representing a third eye, as a bonus action you can take a defensive stance on your turn so long as you have not moved more than half of your movement speed. While in this defensive stance, you reduce any incoming damage by half as you pivot away from the full force of it. This has no effect on spells or magical effects that fully envelops your space, nor does it reduce psychic damage.

As an action, you can invoke a more latent power of the rune, granting you a boon of true foresight. While the rune is invoked, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and as a reaction if you were to be hit by a weapon attack that is not a critical hit, you can avoid the attack entirely. This boon lasts for 1 minute, after which you cannot invoke the power of this rune again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Warrior
entries: Starting at 10th level, your attunement to your runes has given you an unnatural resistance against magical effects. You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. In addition, spell attacks have disadvantage against you if you are within 15 ft of the caster.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Replenishment
entries: At 14th level by spending half of your hit dice during a short rest, you can replenish the usage of invoking latent power for one of your runes. Once you do so, you cannot do so again for that rune until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Runes
entries: At 18th level, choose any two rune options from 3rd or 7th level. Both runes do not have to be from the same list of runes. You learn how to scribe those two runes.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Mastery
entries: At 20th level, you now have 2 uses for invoking the latent power of your runes. In addition, you have learned to transfer the runic energy from one rune to another. You can disable the use of on your runes, causing the rune to go dim and lose its power, to regain an expended use of the latent power of one other rune. The disabled rune becomes active again after a long rest. Once you use this feature you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shaman
entries: As a shaman you have learned to become one with your draconic ancestry, allowing you to temporarily attain the shape of a dragon. However, this transformative power can act as a double edged sword and can be difficult to use in tight places. Shamans tend to be more aggressive and ferocious on the battlefield, but also perceptive and wiser than other warriors.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: {@i 3rd-level Shaman feature}
You gain proficiency in two skills of your choosing from: Animal Handling, Insight, Medicine, Nature, or Survival.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Shape
entries: {@i 3rd-level Shaman feature}

Harnessing the draconic powers that dwell within you, you can transform your shape to resemble a more draconic figure. As an action you can morph your body into that of a dragon. When you take this form, the following rules apply:

items: You retain your ability scores in addition to your skill and saving throw proficiencies.
You can choose whether your items being worn or carried morph into your new form, or drop to the ground at your feet.

You retain the use of your class features provided your new form has the physical capability to do so. You do not retain the usage of your racial abilities, however any damage resistances you had do carry over, racial or otherwise.
You cannot speak or cast spells while in this form, you can however understand and read the languages you knew in your original form.
While in this form, you have natural weapons in the form of bites and claws. Each of these weapons deals 1d10 plus your strength modifier of your choice of slashing or piercing damage.

entries: As part of the same action you used to take this form, you can make a single melee attack using one of your natural weapons provided by this new form.

You can stay in your draconic shape for a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus. You can revert to your normal form earlier by using a bonus action on your turn, and you automatically revert if you fall unconscious, drop to 0 hit points, or die.
You can use this feature once, after which you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest. You gain an additional use of this feature at 7th level, and another one at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Terraforming Form
entries: {@i 7th-level Shaman feature}

Dragons are known for transforming the environment around them using their magical prowess, you inherit said power when you take the form of these mighty mythical beasts. As an action while in your Draconic Shape, you can cause the area around you to shift and turn, transmogrifying the ground beneath you for 1 minute. You create a 20 ft radius of difficult terrain centered on you. This radius moves with you and you are immune to the effects of this difficult terrain. You can choose a number of creatures up to your proficiency bonus to be immune to the effects of this difficult terrain. Depending on the damage you gain resistance to from your Draconic Origins, one of the following effects becomes active, the effects ending when the difficult terrain returns to normal. You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after a long rest. If your effect requires a saving throw, the DC is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Plumes of lava rise from the ground and the ground beneath you becomes volcanic-like in appearance. As a bonus action on your turn, you can make a ranged spell attack using Charisma as your spellcasting ability against a creature you can see within 60 ft of your difficult terrain. On hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage and is on fire. At the start of each of the creatures' turns they take 5 points of fire damage. That creature, or another creature within 5 feet, can use an action to smother out the flames, ending the effect.

entries.name: Cold
entries: The ground beneath you freezes solid and becomes icy terrain. As part of the same action the turn you use your Terraforming Presence, and as an action on all subsequent turns thereafter, you can impose a Constitution saving throw against your Draconian Save DC on each creature suffering the effects of your difficult terrain. On a failed save, the targets take 2d6 cold damage and are incapacitated until the end of your next turn as frost coils around their body, incasing them in ice. On a success, they take no damage and are not incapacitated.

entries.name: Lightning
entries: A heavy lightning storm brews around you. As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can launch a bolt of lightning toward each creature suffering the effects of your difficult terrain. Each creature makes a Dexterity saving throw against your Draconian Save DC. On a failed save, they take 2d6 lightning damage, or half as much on a success. Alternatively, you can use your bonus action to cause lightning bolts to make a blinding flash of light. Each creature suffering the effects of your difficult terrain makes a Constitution saving throw against your Draconian Save DC. On a failed save they are blinded until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Acid
entries: Earthy plants, brambles, and vines rise from the ground around you. As a bonus action, you can cause plants to sprout and release a noxious gas against creatures suffering from your difficult terrain. They make a Constitution saving throw against your Draconian Save DC or take 2d6 poison damage and become poisoned on a failed save, or they take no damage and are not poisoned on a success.

entries.name: Poison
entries: Earthy plants, brambles, and vines rise from the ground around you. As a bonus action, you can cause plants to sprout and release a noxious gas against creatures suffering from your difficult terrain. They make a Constitution saving throw against your Draconian Save DC, or take 2d6 poison damage and become poisoned on a failed save, or they take no damage and are not poisoned on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Draconic Form
entries: {@i 10th-level Shaman feature}

When you assume your Draconic Shape, you become a large creature. If you do not have the space to do so, you remain medium instead. Your natural weapons provided by your draconic form now deal 2d10 damage instead of 1d10 and count as magical for the purposes of overcoming non-magical resistance and immunities.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Terraforming
entries: {@i 14th-level Shaman feature}
The range of your Terraforming Form increases to 20 ft and the damage of its special actions (or bonus actions) increases by 2d6.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Spells
entries: {@i 18th-level Shaman feature}

You can now speak and cast spells while in your draconic shape. You can perform the somatic and verbal components of a spell while in your draconic shape, but you aren't able to provide material components.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Mastery
entries: {@i 20th-level Shaman feature}

When you assume your Draconic Shape, you become a Huge creature instead of large. If there is not enough space to do so, you become large instead. Once per round, you can deal an additional 1d10 damage with your natural weapons.
Whenever you roll initiative without any uses of your Draconic Shape, you regain one use.

subclassFeature.name: Skydancer
entries: Trained in the arts of aerial combat, these dragon warriors are masters of the sky and bring death from above. Soaring through the battlefield with elegance, speed, relentless, and always alert to danger. One strike is never enough.

subclassFeature.name: Skydancer Arts
entries: {@i 3rd-level Skydancer feature}
When you make a running long jump, you can replace the distance you can jump with the distance you can jump with your Lunging Attack, so long as you have the movement to cover said distance.

In addition you have a unique power dwelling inside of you. This power is represented by Skydancer Dice. You have a number of Skydancer Dice equal to twice your proficiency bonus. These dice are d4s and fuel the power of your Skydancer Arts, as detailed below. Your Skydancer dice becomes a d6 at 7th level, a d8 at 14th level, and finally a d10 at 20th level. You can use these special dice for the following Skydancer Arts:

entries.name: Skydancer Leap
entries: When you make a running long or high jump, you can roll your Skydancer Die and extend your jump distance by a number of feet equal to the number rolled. The first time you use this art, you don’t expend the Skydancer Die. All other times you use the art, you expend the die.

entries.name: Skydancer Flurry
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can expend a Skydancer Die and roll it, adding the number rolled to the damage of the attack.

entries.name: Skydancer Assault
entries: When you take the {@action shove|PHB} action, you can roll a Skydancer Die and add the number rolled to the check. If the check is successful you shove the creature an additional 5 feet away from you or, if you knock it prone, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to the number rolled plus your strength modifier. You expend the Skydancer Die only if the check is successful.

subclassFeature.name: Lunging Attack
entries: {@i 3rd-level Skydancer feature}

Once per round, when you take the attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with a lunging attack. You can immediately jump forward a number of feet up to 10 times your proficiency bonus, or a number of feet up to your remaining movement speed, whichever is lower.

You then make an attack using a melee weapon that you are holding or an unarmed strike. If the attack hits, you deal an additional amount of the weapon’s damage equal to a number of Skydancer Dice per 10 feet you jumped as part of this lunging attack.

If a creature or object that wasn’t your original target is in the path of your lunging attack, you can either end your lunging attack early or make that creature or object the new target of your lunging attack.

subclassFeature.name: Skydancer Expertise
entries: {@i 7th-level Skydancer feature}
You gain proficiency in Athletics and Acrobatics if you didn’t already have it. Whenever you make an ability check that uses either of those skills, your proficiency bonus is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Dance of Dragons
entries: {@i 7th-level Skydancer feature}

You can harness the potent energies within you and bring it outward. As a bonus action you can begin your Dance of Dragons which lasts for 1 minute. While your Dance of Dragons is active and you are not wearing medium or heavy armor, or wielding a shield, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you are about to be hit by an attack or fail a dexterity saving throw, as a reaction you expend a Skydancer Die to give yourself a bonus to your AC or save equal to what you roll, potentially turning that attack into a miss or turning the failure into a success.
When you make an attack roll using your Lunging Attack, the attack has advantage.
Once per round, the damage that you deal when using a Skydancer Art or a Lunging Attack gains a bonus equal to your Charisma modifier.
Your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Sky Striker
entries: {@i 10th-level Skydancer feature}
You are a master of the skies, your Skydancer Arts become an extension of yourself giving you these Skydancer Arts that use your Skydancer dice:

entries.name: Sky Dancing
entries: As an action, you can expend a Skydancer die, roll it, and gain a magical flying speed of 40 feet and can hover for a number of minutes equal to the number rolled on the Skydancer die. If you already have a flying speed, it is increased by 20 feet.

entries.name: Sky Strike
entries: While you are flying, when you take the attack action and miss with a melee weapon attack, you can roll a Skydancer die and add it to the attack roll, potentially turning the miss into a hit. You expend the Skydancer die only if you hit with the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Skydancer Alacrity
entries: {@i 14th-level Skydancer feature}
You are granted the gift of speed and alertness from your training as a Skydancer. Your walking speed increases by 10 feet while you’re not wearing medium or heavy armor.
In addition, you can add a bonus to your initiative equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Dancing Fury
entries: {@i 18th-level Skydancer feature}

You’ve honed the art of aerial combat, making you a predator of the skies. While flying, after you’ve taken the attack action you can use a bonus action to immediately make a single weapon attack using a melee weapon or an unarmed strike. If you have the effects of your Dance of Dragons active when doing so, you can make two attacks with this bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Master of the Skies
entries: {@i 20th-level Skydancer feature}

You’ve fully mastered the art of skydancing, making you a true master of the skies. You can expend a Skydancer die to regain a use of your Dance of Dragons feature. You can only do so once and cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

Your walking speed increases by 10 feet and you have a magical flying speed equal to your walking speed. If you already had a flying speed, it increases by 10 feet unless it would otherwise be slower than your walking speed. In that case, your flying speed becomes equal to your walking speed.
In addition, whenever you roll initiative without any remaining Skydancer dice, you regain 3 of them.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic
entries: Trained in the ancient arts of powerful dragons, these warriors are the closest to dragon kin in spirit. While other dragon warriors can physically morph their forms to become dragons, or even emulate the dragons themselves, the mystics are dragons by both blood and spirit. They have ancestral origins to the mighty mythical beasts and their connection to their draconic soul is rivaled only by another mystic.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Soul
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mystic feature}
Your connection to dragons is so grand, you might as well be their kin. Your creature type counts as both your original creature type and dragon.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Style
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mystic feature}

Every dragon has a different style of combat, you’ve specifically trained in one of these styles and mastered the basics of it. As you grow stronger, your mastery over this style of combat improves. Choose one of the following Draconic Styles:

entries.name: Arcane Style
entries: Many dragons have magical power that flows within them, you’ve learned to use this power to a limited degree. You learn two cantrips and one 1st level spell from the sorcerer spell list. You can cast that spell once without expending a spell slot or requiring material components, regaining the ability to cast that spell again after you’ve completed a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells. If a spell you gained from this feature, or from a Draconian Power, requires an action to cast, you can cast it with a bonus action instead.

entries.name: Drake Style
entries: Not all dragon warriors are descendants of true dragons, sometimes they are kin of lesser dragons such as drakes. As such, you are more versed in fighting with a pack of allies rather than relying on your own strength. You can use the {@action help} action as a bonus action. In addition, you have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Dragon Style
entries: The most common and likely style to learn, a form of fighting directly taught by a dragon. Dragons make multiple powerful attacks and focus on maximizing their movements. After you've taken the attack action, immediately as a bonus action you can make one melee attack using a weapon or an unarmed strike. When you roll damage using this bonus action attack, you do not add your ability modifier to the damage roll unless you have the {@optfeature Two-Weapon Fighting} fighting style or a similar ability. Alternatively, you can use a bonus action to move up to half your speed toward a hostile creature.

entries.name: Serpentine Style
entries: You’re nimble and flexible, allowing you to quickly strike and limit an enemy’s movements. When you hit with a melee attack, you can immediately use a bonus action to attempt a {@action grapple} on that target. When you make a {@action grapple} in this way, you can make a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check instead of a Strength (Athletics) check to {@action grapple} the creature. You otherwise follow the {@action grapple} rules as normal. (See page 195 of the Player’s Handbook for more information about the Grapple action.)

entries.name: Wyvern Style
entries: Being descended from one of the lesser dragons, the wyvern, your strikes are more wildly and less calculated but equally more powerful and deadly. As a bonus action, you can make your next melee attack a wild attack, extending the reach of your attack by 5 feet and gaining a bonus 1d4 to the damage of your attack. This bonus increases as you gain levels in this class, becoming 1d6 at 5th level, 1d8 at 11th level, and 1d10 at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Draconic Power
entries: {@i 7th-level Mystic feature}

As part of your training, you’ve chosen to become more familiar with your draconic heritage. You may choose two additional Draconian Powers which don’t count against your total number of Draconian Powers.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Style Improvement
entries: {@i 7th-level Mystic feature}
The Draconic Style you chose gains the following improvement depending on the style you chose:

entries.name: Arcane
entries: You learn two additional spells from the sorcerer spell list. The chosen spells can be any of 2nd or 3rd levels. You can cast either of these spells once without expending a spell slot or requiring material components, regaining the ability to cast that spell again after you’ve completed a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells. If a spell you gained from this feature requires an action to cast, you can cast it with a bonus action instead.

entries.name: Drake
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you would be hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to direct some of the impact of that attack to you. You can halve the damage that creature would have taken and you take that damage instead.

entries.name: Dragon
entries: When you use your bonus action to make an additional attack, you can make two attacks instead. Regardless if you have the {@optfeature Two-Weapon Fighting} fighting style or similar ability, you do not add your ability modifier to the damage rolls of these attacks if done in this way.

entries.name: Serpentine
entries: A creature you {@action grapple} also becomes {@condition restrained} as you enhance your {@action grapple} with a magical power within you. This power can be represented by a spiritual serpent-like dragon coiling around them, but ultimately the flavor of this ability is up to you.

entries.name: Wyvern
entries: When you make a wild attack, you can choose to make that attack at advantage. If you do so, the next attack roll made against you before the start of your next turn has advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Guidance
entries: {@i 10th-level Mystic feature}

Your soul is permanently mixed with your draconic heritage, allowing you to grasp the ancient power of your ancestors in desperate moments. As flavor, you generally do so by seeking guidance from your draconic soul due to your connection to your ancestors. Whenever you fail an ability check you can choose to reroll the d20 but you must use the new result.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Style Advancement
entries: {@i 14th-level Mystic feature}
Depending on the Draconic Style you chose, you gain one of the following benefits:

entries.name: Arcane
entries: You learn two additional spells from the sorcerer spell list. The chosen spells can be any of 3rd or 4th levels. You can cast either of these spells once without expending a spell slot or requiring material components, regaining the ability to cast that spell again after you’ve completed a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells. If a spell you gained from this feature requires an action to cast, you can cast it with a bonus action instead.

entries.name: Drake
entries: When you use the help action, both you and the target of your help action gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Dragon
entries: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet and you gain a climb and swim speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Serpentine
entries: You can grapple a creature of any size category, regardless of the size difference between you and the target of your {@action grapple}.

entries.name: Wyvern
entries: When you hit with your wild attack, the next attack it makes before the start of your next turn has disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Strikes
entries: {@i 10th-level Mystic feature}

Once per round when you hit with a weapon attack or an unarmed strike, you can choose to convert all of the damage from that attack to force as you can release outward the power of your ancestral dragon.
When you do so, you add a bonus 2d8 force damage to the damage of that attack. This bonus becomes 2d10 at 20th level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses after you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Style Mastery
entries: {@i 20th-level Mystic feature}
Depending on the Draconic Style you chose, you gain one of the following benefits:

entries.name: Arcane
entries: When you take the attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with a spell you gained from one of your Mystic features or Draconian Powers, provided you have a use of the chosen spell. You can only do so once per round.

entries.name: Drake
entries: When you or an ally within 5 feet of you hits with an attack, you or that ally can add a bonus to the damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Dragon
entries: Regardless if you have the two-weapon fighting fighting style, or similar ability, or not - you always add your ability modifier to your bonus action attacks made from your Mystic features.

entries.name: Serpentine
entries: Creatures who are {@condition grappled} by you deal half damage with attacks made with weapons or unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Wyvern
entries: You can make two wild attacks as part of your attack action instead of one when you use your bonus action to do so. When you do, the next two attacks made against you before the start of your next turn have advantage.

hp.special: 5 + five times your dragon warrior level

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + PB}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The magen dragon has a magical breath weapon that does damage based on its summoner's draconic origin. If it is not summoned via the Manifest Dragon feature, then you choose a damage type between acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning. Constitution serves for the save DC.

The magen dragon exhales a breath weapon in a 15 ft cone. Each creature in the cone makes a dexterity saving throw or takes {@damage 3d6} damage as mentioned above. On a success they take half damage.

resist.special: shares any resistances it its summoner had

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The magen dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fiery End
entries: If the magen dragon dies, its body disintegrates in a harmless burst of fire and smoke, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The magen dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

optionalfeature.name: All Knowing Eyes
entries: You learn the {@spell identify} spell and can cast it once without requiring components or spending a spell slot. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. Instead of having a range of touch, you can identify an object so long as you can see it and is within 30 ft. Once you cast this spell, you cannot cast it again until you finish a short or long rest. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast this spell using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components and range to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Dragonsong
entries: You gain proficiency in two musical instruments of your choice.

As a bonus action you can evoke the power of your Dragonsong for 1 minute so long as you are not wearing medium or heavy armor. While active, your Dragonsong gives a +1 bonus to your AC and Dexterity Saving throws. You cannot use your Dragonsong again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sight of the Land and Seas
entries: You gain a tremorsense of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Draconian Senses
entries: You gain 60 ft of darkvision. If you already had darkvision, its range increases by 30 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Magi Drakes
entries: You learn the {@spell detect magic} spell and can cast it once without requiring components, regaining the usage of it after a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Treasure
entries: You can detect whether or not gold or magical items are within 30ft of you, but not how much or where specifically. This sense does not properly function if the treasure is worth less than 50 gp in value, or if it is protected by divination magic or if it is wrapped in a thin sheet of lead.

optionalfeature.name: Graceful Fall
entries: You can magically summon forth gales of wind powerful enough to stop your fall. You learn the {@spell feather fall} spell and can cast it without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. You cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Heritage
entries: Regardless of your race, you can take any racial feat that requires a dragonborn, half dragon, or other similar races.

optionalfeature.name: Abstract Origins
entries: Your ancestry was more prominent with dragon-kind than you initially believed, while you do not gain the natural resistances of both worlds, you have multiple dragon-kind in your history. Choose one additional Draconic Origin. You do not gain any additional proficiencies or resistances, but you can now take feats or Draconian Powers with prerequisites requiring that Draconic Origin.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Sigils
entries: You’ve learned how to use special sigils to protect yourself and your belongings. You can carve these sigils into any object big enough to fit them. In order for a sigil to be active, a creature must attune to it as they would a magic item, but this does not count as an attuned magic item nor does it count against your attunement slots. You have three sigils, a creature can only be attuned to one sigil at a time, any attempt to attune to a different sigil ends the attunement on the previous one.

entries.name: Sigil of Storage
entries: This sigil can be stored on any stone or container. Simply tap an item onto the object with the sigil, and it vanishes into an extradimensional space. This space can store up to 100 lbs worth of items. If more than 100 lbs is in use, the object shatters and all the items stored within it drop within 5 ft of the destroyed object. If creatures are occupying that space, they take 2d10 bludgeoning damage. You cannot have an object with an extradimensional storage, such as a bag of holding or similar item inside of an object with the sigil of storage.

entries.name: Sigil of Protection
entries: This sigil can go on any tiny object that can be worn or carried. This object provides a +1 to AC or saving throws (you choose upon attunement). If the attuned creature takes damage, this benefit is subsided until the start of their next turn.

entries.name: Sigil of Warning
entries: If something in your possession is taken without your knowledge, you get an alarm from your head warning you that something is wrong. You do not know what is immediately taken, only that something is missing. In addition, while you are asleep you get a mental ping if a creature comes within 10 ft of you.

optionalfeature.name: Knowledge of the Dragon Kin
entries: You have an astute memory and can recall lore quicker than a scholar. You have advantage on Intelligence ability checks used to recall history, lore, or information on magical creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Legacy
entries: Your draconic blood comes from a dragon from either the Abyss or the Nine Hells. You have resistance to damage from fiends and you do not suffer the negative effects of being in the Abyss or the Nine Hells. In addition, regardless of your race you can take any of the racial feats that has a prerequisite for tiefling, or any race with origins from the Abyss or Nine Hells.

optionalfeature.name: Acidic Shield
entries: Your resistance to acid damage becomes improved when traversing through non-magical acid. If you are partially or fully submerged in non-magical acid, you can traverse through it as if you were swimming through water. If you are fully submerged, you take 4d10 acid damage for every minute you spend submerged. If you are partially submerged, you take 2d10 acid damage for every minute you spend submerged.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Sea Dragon
entries: You can breathe underwater as you do air. In addition, you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. If you already had a swimming speed, it increases by 30 ft.

otherSummary.entry: Gold, Green, Bronze, White, or Black Draconic Origins
otherSummary.entrySummary: Gold, Green, Bronze, White, or Black Draconic Origins

optionalfeature.name: Magma Walk
entries: Your resistance to fire damage becomes improved when traversing through non-magical lava. If you are partially or fully submerged in non-magical lava, you can traverse through it as if you were swimming through water. If you are fully submerged, you take 4d10 fire damage for every minute you spend submerged. If you are partially submerged, you take 2d10 fire damage for every minute you spend submerged.

otherSummary.entry: Gold, Brass, or Red Draconic Origins
otherSummary.entrySummary: Gold, Brass, or Red Draconic Origins

optionalfeature.name: Tundra Walker
entries: You’ve become naturally adept to the frozen climates. You ignore difficult terrain accustomed to frozen wastelands or extremely cold environments, along with any detrimental effects that follows.

In addition, you’ve learned how to use these frozen environments to your advantage. You learn the Armor of Agathys spell and while in one of the aforementioned environments, you can cast it at its lowest level at will, without spending a spell slot or requiring material components. Otherwise, you can cast it once without spending a spell slot and cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast this spell using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Sparks
entries: Lighting coils around your body, making every moment feel electrifying. As a bonus action you summon your Draconic Sparks for 1 minute. While active, your movement speed increases by an amount of feet equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus. In addition, if you take the dash action creatures you move within 5 feet of for the first time on your turn take an amount of lighting damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
Once you’ve used your Draconic Sparks feature, you cannot use it again until you have finished a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Feedback
entries: You magically store energy obtained whenever you are struck by your foes, eventually you release it outward in a powerful blast. Each time you take damage, you store a charge of Kinetic Energy. You can have a maximum number of Kinetic Energy points equal to your proficiency bonus. As an action, you can spend all of your Kinetic Energy points to release outward a powerful shockwave. Every creature within 5ft of you makes a Strength saving throw (dc equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your constitution modifier.) or takes a number of d10 lighting damage equal to the number of Kinetic Energy points spent and is pushed back a number of feet equal to 10 times the amount of Kinetic Energy points spent. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not pushed.
Once you’ve used your Kinetic Feedback feature, you cannot use it again until you have finished a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Toxic Breath
entries: Your Draconian Breath Weapon becomes a Constitution saving throw instead and poisons creatures who fail their save. The poisoned creatures are poisoned for 1 minute and repeat their saving throws at the end of each of their turns, ending the poison on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Cloud Nine
entries: You can magically sit on clouds. Also, as an action you can magically produce a special cloud that you and your allies can ride on for 10 minutes. Up to two medium sized creatures can fit on this cloud. The cloud has a flying speed of 30 ft and can hover, but it cannot ascend any higher than 30 ft off the ground or it loses form. Moving the cloud is a bonus action on your turn.
You can magically produce this cloud a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Endurance
entries: Your metallic scales makes you a tougher foe to fight in martial combat. If you are hit by a weapon attack, as a reaction you can reduce the amount of damage you take by 1d10 plus your proficiency bonus.
After you’ve used your Metallic Endurance twice, you cannot use it again until you’ve finished a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Chromatic Influence
entries: Whenever you make a Charisma ability check or saving throw, you can choose to make the roll at advantage.
Once you’ve used your Chromatic Influence twice, you cannot use it again until you’ve finished a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: You're a Wizard, Dragon
entries: A magical spell book appears into your hands. As a bonus action, you can send this spellbook into an extradimensional space and vice versa. You learn one cantrip from the Wizard spell list. You also learn two first level spells from the Wizard spell list and can cast each of them without requiring material components once, regaining the ability to do so after a long rest. The spells are written into your spellbook, and you can use your spellbook as an arcane focus. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.
When you gain a level in any class, you can replace one of the spells in your spellbook with another spell from the Wizard’s spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Breath Weapon
entries: You gain a magical breath weapon that allows you to exhale elemental energies out to a range of 30 ft. If you chose a chromatic Draconic Origin, it becomes a cone. If you chose a metallic or a gem Draconic Origin, it becomes a line. The breath weapon takes an action to use and its damage corresponds to the damage you resist from the Draconic Origin you chose. Each creature within range of your breath weapon must make a Dexterity saving throw (dc equals 8 + proficiency bonus + constitution modifier) or they take 4d6 points of damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. At level 9 its damage increases by 2d6 and its range increases by 10 ft. It increases again using the same amounts at 12th, 15th, and 18th levels. You have a number of uses of your Draconian Breath Weapon equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Familiar
entries: You can conjure a tiny dragon to keep you company. You can ritual cast the {@spell Find Familiar} spell without requiring material components, but you can only summon a Pseudodragon with this feature. The Pseudodragon has the “Familiar” feature when summoned in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Veroicity
entries: If you move 20 ft towards a creature and make a melee weapon attack against that creature, you add an additional 1d6 damage of the weapon’s type and they make a strength saving throw DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your strength or dexterity modifier. On a failed save, they are knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Shapechanger
entries: You learn the {@spell disguise self} and {@spell alter self} spells, and can cast each of them without requiring components once per short or long rest without spending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Wings
entries: You grow a pair of wings that allows you to fly. While you are wearing medium or light armor, or wearing no armor, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Moderate Draconian Senses
entries: You gain 10 ft of  blindsight and 120 ft of darkvision if you don’t have it already. If you already had darkvision, its range increases by 60 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Insight
entries: As an action you can make a Wisdom (Insight) check opposed against an opposing creature’s Charisma (Deception) check. On a success, you can determine whether the creature is evil, good, or neutral and their creature type.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Draconian Familiar
entries: You can conjure a tiny dragon to keep you company. You can ritual cast the {@spell Find Familiar} spell without requiring material components, but you can only summon a Pseudodragon or a Faerie Dragon with this feature. The Pseudodragon or Faerie Dragon has the “Familiar” feature when summoned in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon's Fury
entries: You have a special action that you can use to unleash a powerful barrage of attacks. You make four melee weapon attacks, but you do not add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage rolls of the last two attacks. If you use an ability modifier for damage other than Strength or Dexterity, the same restriction applies. When you use this feature, you lose the ability to do so, but you roll a d6 at the start of each of your turns. On a 5-6 you regain the usage of this feature. You also regain the usage of this feature when you roll initiative.

optionalfeature.name: Hyper Draconian Senses
entries: You gain 30 ft of  blindsight and 120 ft of darkvision if you don’t have it already. Magical darkness no longer impedes your darkvision. If you already had darkvision, its range increases by 60 ft. If you already had blindsight, its range increases by 20 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Flight
entries: Your ability to fly has greatly improved since you started, and now you can rival the speed of most dragons. Your flying speed increases by 30 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Artifact
entries: A magical artifact with draconic origins appears in your hand. Work with your DM on the specifics of the magical item, but the specific guidelines of the item goes as follows:

items: The item requires attunement, but does not count against your total attunement slots. Only you can attune to this item.
If the item is a weapon, it is a magical weapon with a +3 magic bonus to its attack and damage rolls.

It has one minor beneficial artifact property, one major beneficial artifact property, and one minor detrimental artifact property. You can roll these on their respective tables, or the DM can choose the properties of the item.
If it is an arcane focus, it grants a +2 to spell attack bonus and a +2 to spell save dc.
The item is riddled with draconic scales related to the Draconic Origins of its weidler.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Powers
entries: Your manifested dragon shares the Draconian Powers that you possess that do not have the “Summoner Archetype” prerequisite.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Friendship
entries: When your manifested dragon is within 10 feet of you, it has a bonus to all saving throws equal to your charisma modifier, to a minimum of 1.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Rider
entries: When you manifest your dragon, it comes equipped with an exoctic saddle. This saddle has holsters for up to two weapons and a large quiver that can hold up to 40 arrows. While you are mounted on a dragon, you have the following benefits:

list: You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your dragon.
You can force an attack targeted at your dragon to target you instead.

If your dragon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

optionalfeature.name: Trained Body
entries: You’ve trained your manifested dragon to endure the trials of combat. Your manifested dragon has resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage from non-magical attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Manifest Draconian Magen
entries: As a 1 hour ritual you can summon a dragon-like humanoid to be at your service. Use the Demos Magen statblock with the following changes:

items: Its appearance changes to be more akin to a half dragon or a dragonborn.
It can speak, but only in Draconic.
It has a telepathic link with you, granting it telepathy but only to you out to a range of 100 ft.

entries: Once you have manifested this magen, it remains summoned for 8 hours and you cannot summon it again until you have finished a long rest. If it is reduced to 0 hit points, it dies. You can only have one Draconian Magen summoned at any given time.

optionalfeature.name: Persistent Allies
entries: Whenever your manifested dragon is within 30 feet of you they regain 5 hit points at the start of their turn as long as they have at least 1 hit point. In addition if they fail a saving throw while within 30 ft of you, they can spend their reaction to reroll that saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Summons
entries: When you manifest your dragon, it gains 3 legendary resistances that it can use. See “Legendary Resistance” from an Adult Dragon for reference. These legendary resistances do not recharge per dawn, and you can only give a manifested dragon these legendary resistances once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Invocation of Shadows
entries: As an action, you can assume a shadowy form by spending 2 invoke energy that grants you the powers of a shadow dragon for 1 minute. While in this shadowy form, you gain the following benefits:

items: While in dim light or darkness, you have resistance to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant.
You have advantage on (Dexterity) Stealth checks while in dim light or darkness.

You gain resistance to necrotic damage, and if you have a breath weapon or the Dragonfire Invocation (from a racial ability, feat, spell, or class feature) it can deal necrotic damage instead of its normal damage.

optionalfeature.name: Invocation of Recovery
entries: As an action you can spend invoke energy up to your proficiency bonus to touch a creature and heal them for 1d8 hit points per invoke energy spent. Alternatively, as an action you can spend 2 invoke energy to cure a poison or disease afflicting a creature you touch.

optionalfeature.name: Invocation of Spell Recovery
entries: During a short rest, you can spend hit dice to restore spent 1st level spell slots. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Invocation of Greater Spell Recovery
entries: During a short rest, you can spend hit dice to restore spent 2nd level spell slots. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

otherSummary.entry: Invoker Archetype, Invocation of Spell Recovery
otherSummary.entrySummary: Invoker Archetype, Invocation of Spell Recovery

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Invocation
entries: When you spend invoke energy to use one of your invocations, you gain a legendary resistance. See “Legendary Resistance” from an Adult Dragon for reference. You can only gain up to 3 legendary resistances per long rest, and you can only gain a legendary resistance once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Old Magicks
entries: Magical runes appear on your body with spells stored inside of them. You learn one cantrip from the sorcerer spell list and any two 1st level spells from the sorcerer spell list. When you cast either of these spells, you cannot cast that spell using this rune again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Spell Disruption
entries: A magical rune appears on your hand which contains the power to disrupt spells. You learn the {@spell counterspell} and {@spell dispel magic} spells. When you cast either of these spells, you cannot cast that spell using this rune again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Greater Magicks
entries: You learn two additional spells from the sorcerer spell list. These spells follow the same rules as the ones from the Rune of Old Magicks, but can be of 1st to 3rd level spells.

otherSummary.entry: Runic Scribe, Rune of Old Magicks
otherSummary.entrySummary: Runic Scribe, Rune of Old Magicks

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Runes
entries: Your runic power fills you with old magic that you can use to further protect yourself from modern magic. Whenever you invoke the latent power of your runes, you gain a legendary resistance. See “Legendary Resistance” from an Adult Dragon for reference. You can only gain up to 3 legendary resistances per long rest, and you can only gain a legendary resistance once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Form
entries: While in your Draconic Shape, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and Strength saving throws. In addition, you add an amount of damage to your natural weapons equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Shape
entries: When you use your Draconic Shape, you gain 30 temporary hit points. In addition, you gain 3 Legendary Resistances when you change into your Draconic Shape. See “Legendary Resistance” from an Adult Dragon for reference. You only gain these Legendary Resistance once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Tail
entries: Both in your humanoid shape and your Draconic Shape you have a powerful tail. This tail counts as a natural weapon and does 1d8 bludgeoning damage. It uses Strength for its attack and damage rolls. In your Draconic Shape you have advantage on your athletics check if the creature is your size or smaller.

If you’ve taken the attack action, as a bonus action you can immediately make one tail attack, provided you have not already used your tail as part of your attack action. Instead of dealing damage, using this bonus action you can take the shove action using your tail. See page 195 of the Player’s Handbook for information on the Shove Action.

optionalfeature.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: You have a magical telepathic power that can be summoned at any time. You know the {@spell message} cantrip and can cast it without using components. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Limited Psionics
entries: You have a small pool of psionic power which you can call upon at any time. You know the {@spell Mind Sliver|TCE} cantrip. In addition you know the {@spell Dissonant Whispers} spell and can cast it without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. You cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Psionics
entries: Your psionic powers have grown as you’ve slowly honed them. You learn the {@spell Tasha's Mind Whip|TCE} and {@spell Intellect Fortress|TCE} spells and can cast them without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. When you cast either spell in this manner, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast either of them using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

otherSummary.entry: any Gem Draconic Origin, Limited Psionics
otherSummary.entrySummary: any Gem Draconic Origin, Limited Psionics

optionalfeature.name: Improved Telepathy
entries: Your telepathic powers have improved, allowing you to reach your mind out further than you were able to previously. You learn the {@spell Sending} and {@spell Rary's Telepathic Bond} spells and can cast them without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. When you cast either spell in this manner, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast either of them using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

otherSummary.entry: any Gem Draconic Origin, Limited Telepathy
otherSummary.entrySummary: any Gem Draconic Origin, Limited Telepathy

optionalfeature.name: Gem Growth
entries: As an action you can produce gems out of your body to form a weapon in moments of desperation. When you do so, you form a weapon with the statistics of a {@item dagger} and its properties. Instead of dealing piercing damage, it deals the damage associated with the damage you resist from your Draconic Origin. After you hit with the weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, the weapon is destroyed as the gems are imperfect and brittle. You can use this power a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining the ability to do so after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Leap to the Skies
entries: Using the magical power dwelling within you, you can empower your leaps even further! You learn the {@spell Jump} spell and can cast it without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. The spell does not affect the distance you can jump using your lunging attack. You cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

optionalfeature.name: Dancing Whirlwind
entries: When you use your Lunging Attack while your Dance of Dragons is active, you can forgo your advantage along with any additional attacks you make as part of your attack action to instead make a single weapon attack that targets each creature within 5 feet of the space you land as part of your lunging attack. You use that attack roll to determine if it hits each creature. If it hits at least one of those creatures, you roll the damage as if you had hit one creature, half the total, and deal that damage to each creature that was hit.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Skydancer
entries: When you use a Skydancing Art, you gain a legendary resistance. See “Legendary Resistance” from an Adult Dragon for reference. You can only gain up to 3 legendary resistances per long rest, and you can only gain a legendary resistance once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Arts
entries: You’ve honed your training with just your physical body, enhancing your ability to fight without a weapon. If you aren't wielding any weapons or a shield when you make the attack roll, your unarmed strikes are treated as natural weapons and have the finesse and light properties. In addition, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 plus your strength or dexterity modifier bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage instead of its normal amount.
As a bonus action you can enter either an offensive or defensive stance, when you do so apply one of the following effects depending on your stance:

entries.name: Offensive
entries: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d8 damage instead of 1d6, however you suffer a -2 penalty to your AC.

entries.name: Defensive
entries: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 damage instead of 1d6, however you gain a +2 bonus to AC.

You retain these effects only when you are in the appropriate stance and you can exit or switch your stances as a bonus action on subsequent turns. You exit your stance early if you begin wielding a weapon or a shield.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Ancestors
entries: You learn the {@spell Spirit Shroud|TCE} spell and can cast it once without requiring components, regaining the usage of it after a short or long rest. When you cast the spell using this feature, it deals the damage you resist from your Draconic Origin instead of its original damage options and the dead spirits are instead spirits of the dragons of your ancestry. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components and you follow the spell’s normal guidelines.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Ancestry
entries: When you use your Mystical Strikes feature, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus and you gain a legendary resistance. See “Legendary Resistance” from an Adult Dragon for reference. You can only gain up to 3 legendary resistances per long rest, and you can only gain a legendary resistance once per round.
